HRMO Face Recognition Logbook

Privacy Policy
Effective Date:
This document outlines how we collect, use, and protect your personal and biometric data.

1. Introduction

ASIST ("we," "our," or "us") is committed to protecting the privacy and security of your personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our HRMO Face Recognition Logbook System ("the System").

Important: This Privacy Policy specifically addresses the handling of biometric data collected through our face recognition system. By using the System, you consent to the data practices described in this policy.

2. Information We Collect

2.1. Biometric Data

When you register with the System, we collect:

  • Facial Recognition Data: Mathematical representations (templates) of your facial features
  • Registration Images: Reference images used to create your facial template (securely stored and encrypted)
  • Verification Logs: Records of when your face was scanned for authentication purposes

2.2. Personal Information

In addition to biometric data, we may collect and process:

  • Employee identification number
  • Name and contact information
  • Department and position information
  • Work schedule and attendance records

2.3. Technical Information

Automatically collected when using the System:

  • Device information (type, operating system)
  • Log data (IP address, access times, system errors)
  • Usage patterns and authentication history

3. How We Use Your Information

PURPOSE TYPE OF DATA LEGAL BASIS
Time and attendance tracking Biometric data, verification logs Legitimate business interest, employment contract
Identity verification and fraud prevention Biometric templates, facial recognition data Security purposes, legitimate business interest
Payroll processing and reporting Attendance records, employee information Contractual necessity, legal obligation
System maintenance and improvement Technical information, usage patterns Legitimate business interest
Compliance with legal obligations All relevant data as required Legal requirement

Restricted Use: We will never use your biometric data for:

  • Marketing or advertising purposes
  • Surveillance beyond attendance tracking
  • Sharing with third parties for unrelated purposes
  • Creating facial recognition databases for external use

4. Data Sharing and Disclosure

4.1. Internal Sharing

Your data may be accessed by:

  • HRMO personnel for attendance management
  • IT department for system maintenance
  • Management for reporting and analytics (aggregated data only)
  • Payroll department for compensation processing

4.2. Third-Party Service Providers

We may share data with trusted service providers who assist in:

  • System hosting and maintenance
  • Data encryption and security services
  • Technical support and troubleshooting

All third-party providers are contractually bound to maintain confidentiality and implement appropriate security measures.

4.3. Legal Requirements

We may disclose your information if required by:

  • Law enforcement with valid legal process
  • Regulatory authorities for compliance audits
  • Legal proceedings where disclosure is required

4.4. Business Transfers

In the event of a merger, acquisition, or sale of assets, your data may be transferred as part of the transaction. You will be notified of any such change in ownership or control.

5. Data Security

5.1. Security Measures

We implement comprehensive security measures including:

Encryption
Access Controls
Network Security
Audit Logging
Regular Updates

5.2. Biometric Data Protection

Special protections for biometric data:

  • Biometric templates are stored separately from personal identifiers
  • Encryption both in transit and at rest
  • Regular security assessments and penetration testing
  • Strict access controls with multi-factor authentication

5.3. Incident Response

We have established procedures for:

  • Prompt detection of security incidents
  • Containment and investigation of breaches
  • Notification to affected individuals and authorities as required by law
  • Remediation and prevention of future incidents

6. Data Retention

6.1. Retention Periods

DATA TYPE RETENTION PERIOD NOTES
Biometric templates Until employment termination + 30 days Immediately deleted upon termination unless legal hold applies
Attendance records 7 years Required for legal and tax purposes
System access logs 2 years Security and audit purposes
Employee information 7 years post-employment Legal and reference purposes

6.2. Data Deletion

Upon termination of employment or at your request (where applicable), we will:

  1. Permanently delete your biometric templates from active systems
  2. Archive other employment data as required by law
  3. Provide confirmation of data deletion upon request

7. Your Rights

Depending on your jurisdiction, you may have the following rights regarding your personal data:

Rights Overview

  • Right to Access: Request a copy of your personal data we hold
  • Right to Correction: Request correction of inaccurate data
  • Right to Deletion: Request deletion of your data (subject to legal requirements)
  • Right to Restrict Processing: Request limitation on how we use your data
  • Right to Data Portability: Receive your data in a structured, commonly used format
  • Right to Object: Object to certain types of processing
  • Right to Withdraw Consent: Withdraw previously given consent (where applicable)

7.1. Exercising Your Rights

To exercise any of these rights, please contact us using the information in Section 10. We will respond to your request within 30 days, as required by applicable law.

7.2. Verification

For security purposes, we may need to verify your identity before processing certain requests, especially those involving sensitive biometric data.

8. International Data Transfers

If your data is transferred outside your country of residence, we ensure appropriate safeguards are in place, such as:

  • Standard Contractual Clauses approved by relevant authorities
  • Binding Corporate Rules for intra-company transfers
  • Other legally approved transfer mechanisms

We will only transfer your data to countries with adequate data protection laws or where we have implemented appropriate safeguards.

9. Children's Privacy

The System is not intended for use by individuals under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If we become aware that we have collected personal data from a child without parental consent, we will take steps to remove that information from our systems.

10. Changes to This Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy periodically to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will notify you of any material changes by:

  • Posting the updated policy on our intranet/company portal
  • Sending email notifications to all employees
  • Requiring re-acknowledgment of the updated policy where appropriate

The "Effective Date" at the top of this policy indicates when it was last revised.
